intro: Bossiaea milesiae, commonly known as the Western Australian bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in full sun. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces distinctive seed pods that split open when mature. Bossiaea milesiae is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
